data.title: Business
data.text: Wonderful experience for our business meetings and room accommodations. Easy to work with, great customer service.  The  staff of the hotel are friendly and welcoming. YOu can not go wrong in selecting this hotel.

data.title: When in Knoxville
data.text: Solid facility with great location. Enjoyed the concierge lounge- only warning is we were there for homecoming weekend and a large party was occurring in the suite across the hall and didn't wrap up until 3:30. Other than that it is the best place to stay near campus

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to tell us and others about your stay at our hotel. Truly pleased that you enjoyed your time with us and we do apologize that the surrounding guests disturbed you in your room. We will look forward to your return.

Sincerely,


Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best outdoor bar fire pit
data.text: I want to go back to this hotel just for the outdoor bar area. Great drinks, friendly bartender and the outdoor bar is so fun with the fire pit table. Plenty of seating all around, Starbucks just in the door. Nice restaurant inside too. Lobby is nice with modern furniture.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback on our new outdoor patio bar at the hotel. We are proud of the new area and happy to hear that it helped you enjoy your stay.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Family wedding weekend
data.text: Great family experience, concierge floor great as was concierge area...enjoyed the breakfast and snacks throughout the day including fresh fruit.  Diet coke on ice, I was a happy girl.. loved the Peter Thomas Roth toiletries as well

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for the kind comments about our hotel and service. We are  grateful for your business and will look forward to your return.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Super convenient and dog-friendly
data.text: I had to sneak in a business stop on my way to vacation and was struggling to find a hotel that would allow me to bring my adult Rhodesian ridgeback dog along with me. This hotel was incredibly accommodating and even kept my pup occupied with dog treats while I checked in. All the dogs stay on one floor so as not to disturb other guests, which was a huge relief for me even though my dog is not a barker. The hotel is in a super convenient location right off of I40 making it the perfect place to stop over for the night!

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Just wanted to thank you for the wonderful review on our hotel and staff. We are truly pleased that you enjoyed your stay and are very thankful that you told us about your experience. 

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Snail Motion  "The Marble City Kitchen"
data.text:
We eat out very frequent.  One of the Restaurant was the Marble City, the food is excellent the drinks and cocktails are fabulous, the hostess Glo, has a welcome approach to all she comes in contact with and a southern hospitallity smile.
The problem is the KITCHEN, it takes fourty five minutes to one hour of waiting for just salads, the bar drinks are fine but how much can one person drink for an hour?, while waiting for just salads, we usually don't wait after fourty minutes we are gone.
A few months later we tried again and similar scenario happen and with a waiter that did not come around.  Needless to say we will not eat there again until they get their kitchen in motion!

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for telling us about your experience at our hotel and in our restaurant. I truly appreciate professional feedback as it is vital to our success. I was sorry to hear that your service was slow during your experiences with us. I would love to speak to you personally to review and correct the issue if you would like to reach out to me at the hotel. I thank you for your response and trust that I speak with you soon.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: To much money for low quality
data.text: This hotel was so over price for the quality of the room. It;s downtown and we had a wedding that the bride used for her guest. Bad choice. We had to pay to park which was a surprise and the breakfast had cold food and even the coffee was cold.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

I just want to apologize to your for the poor experience that you had during your stay with us. We will take your comments and address them from the top down understanding that is a reflection of all of us when we fail to reach expectations. I would love to speak with you personally to fully understand your experience and how we can specifically get better. I will look forward to hopefully speaking with you.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan 
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great outside bar area, OK hotel
data.text:
Hotel was nicely located.  Garage was next to the hotel and seemed to always have space, although I saw people parking on the roof a few times.

The room was OK.  I stayed in one ending with the number "21" and heard very strange noises all the time.  I was 3 rooms away from the elevator, but I think it must have been the elevator or the pipes. I also saw something I've never seen in hotels before. Many times during the day I entered my room and saw multiple doors on my floor with the security bar propping the door open.  I think there may have been many university students staying in the hotel, and perhaps this was something they all did. 

The outdoor area near the outside bar was very comfortable and actually the best place to sit in all of the city.  There was a glass firepit, comfortable chairs and fans, and enough trees to block the sight and sounds of the nearby street.  I was fortunate enough to work outside in this area for several days and it was very nice.

Overall OK hotel, great outside area.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to give us your professional and thoughtful feedback on our hotel. Although I am pleased that you enjoyed our newly added outdoor area to the hotel.  I am sorry that the other areas of the hotel did not fully reach your expectations. I trust that we will have another opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice place to stay
data.text: I would consider staying at this hotel if back in the area.  The hotel is clean and inviting.  The room also was clean and inviting.  I recommend this hotel if staying in the area.  Close to dining and shops.  At the time of my stay not a lot of traffic/congestion.  Architecture of neighboring buildings are very interesting due to their time of construction.  Nice place to visit and the hotel was very close to the University of Tennessee Knoxville campus.

owner_response.author: Team_Guestservice, Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Kristina J,

Thank you for you glowing review and we are so happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations during your stay. We hope you will visit with us again when your travels bring you to the Knoxville area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Just ok.
data.text: Room was clean, bed comfortable. Garage was not very convenient, especially for $13 a day. There are hotels closer to the center of town. Hard getting in and out, especially since there are a lot of one way streets. Restaurants a few blocks away.

owner_response.author: Team_Guestservice, Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Stephen K,

Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear that you found our rooms comfortable and enjoyed your stay.  We're sorry that the parking experience didn't meet your expectations, but we do hope you will consider us for future visits based on our quality rooms and superior guest service.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Location is everything!
data.text: This Hilton property is just in the perfect location in downtown Knoxville, TN.  It is so close to so many wonderful restaurants and attractions that are walking distance to the hotel.  The hotel is nice and has an awesome restaurant as well that provides a great atmosphere and it stays open late!  I would recommend this hotel for all age groups. The staff is great as well.  I had one issue where my AC unit was making a weird noise but the manager sent engineering up right away to correct the issue.  I stay here every time I'm in the area.

owner_response.author: Team_Guestservice, Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Jennifer L,

Thank you so much for your excellent review - we are always happy to hear that we exceeded guest expectations and appreciate that you enjoyed our newly launched restaurant concept.  We're sorry that you experienced an issue with your AC unit, but are thankful that our engineering department was able to correct the issue quickly.  We look forward to welcoming you back when you visit the Knoxville area in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Location, Decent Room, Starbucks!!
data.text: My stay at the Knoxville Hilton was fine.  The room as nice enough, the staff was nice enough, the location was excellent.  I was tickled to see all the pooches around.  Apparently this hotel is VERY pet friendly and I approve!

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback from your recent stay with us. I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay and atmosphere at the hotel. We will look forward to your prompt return.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly staff, good location
data.text: We got a good deal on Hilton which made it good value. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room very comfy. Knoxville itself was great - hotel is centrally located near market square for restaurants etc.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Just taking a moment to thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel. We are delighted that you had a great experience and will hope to see you again in the near future. 

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great downtown location
data.text: Excellant hotel..location....easy 2 block walk to city square for restaurants..very dog friendly hotel.  4th visit to this hotel and we always enjoy the experience.  And so does our dog.  You can walk almost anywhere in this town from the hotel.  the breakfast is 1st class.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

On behalf of our entire team I wanted to say thank you for the wonderful review and for your business. We are honored that you took the time to tell others about your experience. We look forward to saving you again in the near future.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Restaurant was the highlight
data.text:
The hotel itself is absolutely showing it's age - at least in the rooms. 

However, we had breakfast both days in the hotel restaurant and Varnell, our waiter, was absolutely outstanding. The food was also very, very good (it was included in our hotel room price). Thank you to Varnell for making it such a wonderful experience and showing us how hospitable Knoxville can be.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your honest and professional review of our hotel and service. We will look to improve our facility for our guests and will only reach our goals with loyal customers like you. Thank you for your comments and we look forward to serving you again in the future.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Accomodating
data.text: I stayed in the Hilton for a reunion of volunteers (IVS).  The hotel room was what one would expect, at a Hilton - comfortable and clean.  The staff was exceptionally friendly.  When my wife and I arrived in Knoxville we were stranded at a closed bus station with no taxis anywhere.  It was late at night.  I called several cabs but because it was just a short hop to the hotel, none ever showed and we were worried.  I called the hotel and explained our situation.  Within minutes, the hotel had sent a car to pick us up.  What service - beyond the call of duty!

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for the wonderful story within your review. We pride ourselves on great service and it warms our hearts and motivates our entire team to read reviews such as yours.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bama Game
data.text:
The staff at this hotel is Top Notch. Absolutely phenomenal customer service. I sat back and watched a customer berate one of the staff, a young man named Benjamin. He  never wavered, never changed focus but continued to try and help the out of line customer and maintained a level of professionalism I rarely see.  He then helped our group, his overwhelmingly helpful demeanor never changing, just a genuine customer first attitude. Our rooms were impeccable, housekeeping was extraordinary , the food was excellent, beers were cold and I will recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone who will listen.
Great Job folks, and Roll Tide!!!!

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for coming down for the big game and thank you for being so gracious in your review. It is so pleasing and motivating to hear from our loyal customers like yourself. We will look forward to your return.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Facility needs to be gutted and redone
data.text: Facility needs to be gutted and redone. The service was great but it was old and looked like they slapped lipstick on a pig. The location is great and if they would renovate by gutting the place and redoing the bathrooms it could be great.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

A quick thank you for your candid review of our hotel. Although we are improving our property it still is important for us to hear from our key custovers.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: one nighter
data.text: very confusing to find, construction around it.  the staff was friendly, though not southern hospitality.  the room was okay, but very pricey.  we went to the little plaza in town and found it to be nice. had lunch there, but not wowed.  definitely college town.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for telling us about your stay with us. I am sorry that the local construction made the hotel difficult to access. I do trust that we have another opportunity to serve you and to give you an experience that we both expect from a Hilton property.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not customer-focused
data.text: So far this hotel is really disappointing. After a 3 hour + wait for our room to be ready for check-in, the adjoining riverview rooms we had reserved were NOT made available to us (despite being told when we first got here and left our bags in the valet area that they were being cleaned and then we would get them). We're on a mid level, not adjoining rooms, but they still haven't taken the up-charge for the riverview rooms off of our bill. They still have the wrong HHonors # in the system for my room; the young person at the front desk told me I had to call their online system to change it. I called, and was sent an e-mail with the new code. Problem was that I couldn't get ON the wifi in the room WITHOUT the code, so I had to go down to the ballroom floor, hook onto the free convention wifi, get the code, log into HHonors to get my free wifi, and then come back up to my mediocre room to log into the wifi here so that I could go online from my room. The very young desk staff are earnest but don't appear to have a clue as to what they are doing, and the manager has still not called back to answer my question about the billing. I will be very glad to get out of here, and I will never come back, or recommend that anyone else do so. This is a terrible way to do business.

owner_response.author: PJordanGM, General Manager at Hilton Knoxville, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

My sincere apologies for your frustrations. I feel confident that if able to speak with you that we would be able to properly address and the correct the situation. Please feel free to reach out to me at the hotel at your convenience. I will look forward to speaking with you.

Sincerely,

Paul Jordan
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response
